profileText: A Delegate from Virginia; born in Eagles Nest, King George County, Va., August 24, 1741; pursued classical studies with private teachers; engaged in agricultural pursuits; member of the State house of delegates in 1776 and 1777; Member of the Continental Congress in 1779; again a member of the State house of delegates in 1780, 1781, 1787, and 1788; served in the State senate 1781-1785; died in Ravensworth, Fairfax County, Va., June 6, 1809; interment in the private cemetery on the Ravensworth estate.

researchRecord.name: In the Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection, 1781, 1 item.
In the Edward Dixon Papers, ca. 1743-1808, 6 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Individuals represented include William Fitzhugh. A finding aid is available in the repository. The collection is also available on microfilm.

researchRecord.name: In the Records of John Glassford and Company, ca. 1743-1886, 62 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Individuals represented include William Fitzhugh. A finding aid is available in the repository and online. The collection is also available on microfilm.

researchRecord.name: In the Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection, 1775, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Alexander Spotswood to Members of the Virginia Convention, including William Fitzhugh, in which he volunteers to raise a Virginia regiment for service in the Revolutionary War.

researchRecord.name: In the Johnston Family Papers, 1779-1891, 167 pages and 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include William Fitzhugh. An inventory is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Tazewell Family Papers, 1772-1866, 1 booklet and 4 volumes.
researchRecord.description: Subjects covered include William Fitzhugh. An inventory is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the George Washington Papers, 1778-1799, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Subjects covered in the papers include William Fitzhugh.

researchRecord.name: In the Fitzhugh Family Papers, 1775-1901, 355 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers include correspondence from William Fitzhugh of Chatham, Stafford County, Virginia, to his nephew, Benjamin Grymes of Eagles Nest, Stafford County, Virginia. William Fitzhugh writes regarding crops, especially wheat and tobacco, slaves, the family, and his health.

recordLocation.name: Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, Alderman Library

researchRecord.name: In the Benjamin Harrison Papers, ca. 1779-1788, 57 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include William Fitzhugh. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.
